decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back powerful threats like Arclight Phoenix. It utilizes cheap, efficient spells to trigger Phoenix's ability while also controlling the board with cards like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash. The deck also has card draw and selection to consistently find the pieces it needs to win. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and powerful creatures, closing out the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main idea behind this deck is to utilize the Krark-Clan Ironworks combo to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage by sacrificing artifacts like Terrarion, Chromatic Star, and Chromatic Sphere. Scrap Trawler is used to recur these artifacts from the graveyard, while Sai, Master Thopterist and Myr Retriever provide additional value by creating Thopter tokens and retrieving artifacts, respectively. The deck also includes cards like Engineered Explosives and Pyrite Spellbomb for removal and additional utility. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful plays.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponents' spells, removing threats, and drawing cards to maintain card advantage. It utilizes cards like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage for versatility, while also having a strong land disruption package with Field of Ruin and Ghost Quarter. The win condition comes from planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, as well as creatures like Celestial Colonnade. The deck aims to outvalue opponents with efficient removal and powerful threats, ultimately grinding out a victory through control and card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of artifacts and specific cards to generate mana and draw cards, ultimately leading to a powerful game-winning combo. The key concept revolves around the interaction between Krark-Clan Ironworks, Scrap Trawler, and various artifacts. By sacrificing artifacts and utilizing their abilities, players can generate copious amounts of mana, trigger card draw effects, and create a loop that allows for continuous recursion and card advantage. The deck also includes various supporting cards such as Ancient Stirrings and Inventors' Fair to help find the necessary combo pieces.

The deck revolves around assembling the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle along with Primeval Titan to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast Scapeshift, allowing the player to search for multiple Valakut lands and Mountains to trigger their abilities simultaneously and deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes removal and card draw to control the board and find the combo pieces efficiently.

This deck focuses on utilizing +1/+1 counters to boost the power and toughness of creatures quickly, with cards like Hangarback Walker, Metallic Mimic, and Walking Ballista. Arcbound Ravager and Arcbound Worker help distribute counters while cards like Ancient Stirrings and Mox Opal help with card draw and mana acceleration. The deck also includes support cards like Animation Module and Throne of Geth to further enhance the +1/+1 counter strategy. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient aggro strategy centered around Hardened Scales.

The main idea of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces necessary to generate mana, draw cards, and loop artifacts in order to create a powerful engine of resource generation. By utilizing cards like Krark-Clan Ironworks, Scrap Trawler, and Myr Retriever, the deck aims to generate infinite mana and card advantage to overwhelm the opponent and win the game. With the help of various artifacts and mana accelerants, this deck can create a combo chain that quickly snowballs into victory.

The key premise of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana by sacrificing artifacts like Myr Retriever and Scrap Trawler using Krark-Clan Ironworks. This combo allows the player to draw cards and potentially assemble a win condition using cards like Sai, Master Thopterist. The deck also includes ways to protect itself and disrupt the opponent through cards like Engineered Explosives and Ichor Wellspring. The mana base is built to support the combo with utility lands like Buried Ruin and Inventors' Fair.

The main concept of this deck is to use cheap spells and efficient card draw to quickly fill the graveyard with spells, allowing for early play of Arclight Phoenix and Thing in the Ice. By utilizing burn spells to control the board and protect your threats, you aim to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and tempo swings. The inclusion of Crackling Drake provides additional threat and card advantage, making it a versatile option in putting pressure on the opponent. The deck thrives on being able to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost, high-impact creatures and burn spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear alongside powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent and finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize. With a focus on consistent damage output and fast-paced gameplay, this deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

This Red Deck Wins archetype focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to finish off opponents. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent early in the game and finish them off before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack helps to disrupt opponent's plans and prevent them from gaining life or playing spells effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing aggressive red creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also incorporating burn spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Boros Charm to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while efficiently removing threats with cards like Searing Blaze and Lightning Helix. The mana base is built to support the aggressive gameplay with fetch lands like Arid Mesa and Bloodstained Mire to ensure consistent access to the required colors of mana.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix while controlling the board with cheap removal spells. The deck also includes cards like Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake to provide additional threats and win conditions. The mana base is optimized for casting spells quickly and efficiently, emphasizing the importance of hitting specific colors for key spells. Overall, this deck aims to be fast, aggressive, and disruptive, overwhelming opponents with a constant stream of threats and powerful plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing cycling creatures and cascade spells to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, then casting Living End to return them all to the battlefield. By cycling through the deck quickly and efficiently, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a large number of powerful creatures out of nowhere. The inclusion of cards like Faerie Macabre and Fulminator Mage helps disrupt the opponent's strategy while advancing your own game plan. The deck aims to execute its combo as quickly as possible to put pressure on the opponent and secure the win.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures with Death's Shadow as a central threat. By using cards like Street Wraith and Thought Scour to lower their life total quickly, Death's Shadow can become a massive threat early in the game. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control the opponent's game plan. With efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, along with the potential for explosive damage with Temur Battle Rage, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm and defeat the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly cast spells that can generate card advantage and bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to the battlefield. The deck includes various cantrips, burn spells, and cheap creatures to enable the aggressive playstyle, allowing the player to overwhelm their opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game, disrupting the opponent's strategy and closing out the game before they have a chance to recover.
